For me\, it got me to feel so many things. I really thought I was going to hate the game. SPOILERS When you get to play as Abby\, the game feels unbearably long\, because of the tension in the theater you just left. All I could think of was getting back there to figure out what the hell happens. Plus you hate Abby.  When they tried to get me to feel for her i wasnt biting. I did not care about her\, or her past\, or her relationships. She killed Joel. But I thank God they did draw it out\, because that gave me the time I needed to humanize and forgive Abby. They got me so late in Abby's story. When I saw what she went through to help those Scars\, I didnt see a villian anymore. I saw an actual person with a good heart. When her friend scolds her and tells her shes not a good person and Abby breaks down because she can't seem to forgive herself either. She wasnt happy with what she did but I think she was looking for peace just like Ellie was trying to do when she went back for Abby. The game made me go from this completely one-sided blind hatred\, to compassion and wanting nothing but the best for her. I WRESTLED WITH MYSELF pushing the attack buttons on the final scene.
